tn.text: A new poem begins. See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]].
"Think about" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"look at the shameful state we are in"

tn.ref: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers
tn.text: "You have allowed strangers to take possession of our inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"you have allowed foreigners to take possession of our houses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: We have become orphans ... our mothers are like widows
tn.text: The people of Jerusalem have no one to protect them because the men have either died in battle or have gone into exile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: We must pay silver for the water we drink
tn.text: "We have to pay silver to our enemies in order to drink our own water"

tn.ref: we must pay silver to get our own wood
tn.text: "our enemies sell us our own wood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Those who are coming after us
tn.text: The Babylonian army.
AT: "made a treaty with" or "surrendered to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
AT: "so that we would have food to eat"
AT: "they have died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
AT: "we bear the punishment for their sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Possible meanings are 1) "Now the people who rule over us are themselves slaves to their own masters in Babylon" (UDB) or 2) "People who used to be slaves in Babylon now rule over us."

tn.ref: to deliver us from their hand
tn.text: Here the word "hand" refers to power. AT: "to rescue us from their power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: because of the sword in the wilderness
tn.text: AT: "because there are people in the wilderness who kill others with swords" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Women are raped in Zion ... virgins in the cities of Judah
tn.text: AT: "All the women, young and old, are raped in Jerusalem and in the cities of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Princes are hung up by their own hands
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "With their own hands, they hung princes" or 2) they tied each prince's hands together with one end of a rope and tied the other end so the prince's feet could not touch the ground.
men who are no longer "vigorous men"
where the elders would give legal advice, but also where people would meet socially
part of social life at the city gate

tn.ref: The crown has fallen from our head
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "We no longer wear flowers on our heads for celebrations" or 2) "We no longer have a king." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "we can hardly see because of our tears"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lam:04:03|4:3]]. Ruined, deserted places were thought to be inhabited by certain kinds of wild animals, including jackals.
"your power and authority to rule as king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "always" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Why do you forget us forever? Why do you forsake us for so many days?
tn.text: AT: "It is as though you will forget us forever or not come back to us for a very long time!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Renew our days as they were long ago
tn.text: AT: "Make our lives good, like they used to be" or "Make us as great as we used to be" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: unless you have utterly rejected us and you are angry with us beyond measure
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) that the writer is afraid that Yahweh might be too angry to restore them or 2) that he is saying that Yahweh is too angry to restore them (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
